title: Tear Gas Deployed as Protesters Hurl Molotov Cocktails in Central Hong Kong
text:
Protests to coincide with China’s National Day took place in Hong Kong on Tuesday, October 1, with several clashes between protesters and police reported across the island, and multiple instances of the use of Molotov cocktails and tear gas.

Police reportedly used live rounds against protesters in other locations, with videos showing the shooting of one protester in Tsuen Wan going viral.

Hong Kong media reported that the protester was taken to hospital in critical condition after being shot with a live round. The South China Morning Post said the protester was a high school student.

Up to 150,000 people took part in the protests, according to opposition activists cited by journalists on the ground, despite a ban by authorities. Police deployed tear gas in multiple areas across Hong Kong, according to the South China Morning Post, with much of the local metro network forced to close, and businesses across the island shutting their doors for the day. Credit: @852goldfingrrr via Storyful
